item.title: 路透社调查显示第一季度墨西哥经济持平
item.description: 路透社周二的一项民意调查显示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策起伏不定，墨西哥经济在2025年前三个月可能保持平稳。【原文：Mexico's economy likely remained flat in the first three months of 2025 as a result of uncertainty generated by U.S. President Donald Trump's fluctuating tariff policies, a Reuters poll showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，巴宝莉开始寻找主席格里-墨菲（Gerry Murphy）的继任者
item.description: 据天空新闻周二报道，英国奢侈品牌巴宝莉正在评估接替格里-墨菲（Gerry Murphy）担任董事长的潜在人选。【原文：British luxury brand Burberry is evaluating potential candidates to succeed Gerry Murphy as chairman, Sky News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加拿大 RBC 银行放弃可持续金融目标
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行周二表示，随着衡量和报告可持续金融的行业实践不断发展，该行将放弃可持续金融目标。【原文：Canada's Royal Bank of Canada will abandon its sustainable finance goals as industry practices for measuring and reporting sustainable finance have evolved, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 媒体报道称，特朗普致电贝索斯抱怨亚马逊的报告
item.description: 据多家媒体报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二上午致电亚马逊执行董事长杰夫-贝索斯，抱怨该公司计划显示关税影响的价格的报道。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump called Amazon Executive Chairman Jeff Bezos on Tuesday morning to complain about a report the company planned to display prices that show the impact of tariffs, according to multiple media outlets.】

item.title: 法雷奥称其运往美国的 90% 墨西哥产品目前符合 USMCA 标准
item.description: 法国汽车零部件供应商法雷奥表示，该集团在墨西哥生产并进口到美国的 90% 的产品现在都符合《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协议》（USMCA）。【原文：French car parts supplier Valeo said 90% of the products produced by the group in Mexico and imported into the U.S. are now compliant with the United States-Mexico-Canada-Agreement (USMCA).】

item.title: 在关税不确定的情况下，ASM 国际公司预计本财年销售额将增长 10%-20%。
item.description: 计算机芯片设备制造商 ASM International（ASMI）周二表示，在全球贸易紧张局势和对等关税增加了宏观经济不确定性的情况下，按固定汇率计算，预计年销售额将实现两位数的增长。【原文：Computer chip equipment maker ASM International (ASMI) said on Tuesday it expects annual sales to grow in a double-digit percentage range, at constant currencies, amid global trade tensions and reciprocal tariffs which have increased macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 英国 M&S 称网络攻击影响了部分商店的食品供应
item.description: 英国零售商玛莎百货公司周二表示，由于继续应对 "网络事件"，一些商店的部分食品出现短缺。【原文：British retailer Marks & Spencer said on Tuesday some stores have been left short of some food items as it continues to grapple with a "cyber incident".】

item.title: 嘉士伯称丹麦人抵制可口可乐等美国产品
item.description: 嘉士伯首席执行官雅各布-阿鲁普-安德森（Jacob Aarup-Andersen）周二表示，丹麦消费者正在抵制可口可乐，并补充说，这家在丹麦灌装可口可乐饮料的啤酒生产商已经看到可口可乐的销量在下降，而本地竞争对手的份额却在增加。【原文：Danish consumers are boycotting Coca-Cola, Carlsberg CEO Jacob Aarup-Andersen said on Tuesday, adding the brewer, which bottles the drink in Denmark, had seen Coca-Cola volumes decline while local rivals gain share.】

item.title: Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 推出独立人工智能助手应用
item.description: Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 周二为其 Meta 人工智能助手推出了一款独立应用，类似于微软支持的 OpenAI 和 Alphabet 旗下谷歌提供的应用。【原文：Facebook parent Meta Platforms on Tuesday launched a separate app for its Meta AI assistant, similar to those offered by Microsoft-backed OpenAI and Alphabet's Google.】

item.title: 英特尔采用新制造工艺的测试芯片备受关注
item.description: 英特尔周二表示，其几家合同制造客户计划为公司即将推出的先进制造工艺制造测试芯片，该工艺目前仍在开发中。【原文：Intel said on Tuesday several of its contract manufacturing customers planned to build test chips for the company's forthcoming advanced manufacturing process that is currently still in development.】

item.title: 特朗普将放宽对在美生产的汽车制造商征收的关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将签署一项命令，对在美国生产汽车的汽车制造商减免部分25%的新汽车关税，以使他们有时间将零部件供应链带回国内。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an order giving automakers building vehicles in the U.S. relief from part of his new 25% vehicle tariffs to allow them time to bring parts supply chains back home, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 环球音乐集团第一季度销售额超预期
item.description: 环球音乐集团周二公布的第一季度销售额高于市场预期，主要得益于录制音乐和音乐出版业务的增长。【原文：Universal Music Group reported first-quarter sales above market expectations on Tuesday, helped by growth in recorded music and music publishing.】

item.title: 富国银行投资者批准高管薪酬，合规整改势头强劲
item.description: 富国银行股东周二批准了高管薪酬方案和董事任命，并获得了绝大多数股东的支持。【原文：Wells Fargo shareholders on Tuesday approved executive pay packages and appointment of directors with strong majority support.】

item.title: 特朗普入主白宫 100 天内华尔街的赢家和输家
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普总统 1 月 20 日重返白宫以来，美国内政外交政策发生了巨大转变，给全球金融市场带来了震荡。【原文：The dramatic shift in U.S. domestic and foreign policy since President Donald Trump returned to the White House on January 20 has sent shockwaves across global financial markets.】

item.title: 卫星制造商 Apex 筹集 2 亿美元资金，提高金顶卫星的产量
item.description: 卫星制造商 Apex 公司周二表示，该公司已筹资 2 亿美元，用于提高产量，满足对其可配置航天器平台激增的需求，并希望未来能获得利润丰厚的金顶导弹防御盾牌合同。【原文：Satellite manufacturer Apex has raised $200 million to increase production and meet surging demand for its configurable spacecraft platforms and in hopes of snagging lucrative Golden Dome missile defense shields contracts in the future, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 花旗集团股东批准首席执行官和高管 2024 年薪酬及新股授予
item.description: 在本周二举行的虚拟年度会议上，花旗集团绝大多数股东批准了首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）加薪 33% 至 3 450 万美元的决定，以及其他高级管理人员的薪酬。【原文：A large majority of Citigroup shareholders has approved CEO's Jane Fraser's 33% pay increase to $34.5 million at a virtual annual meeting held on Tuesday, as well as the compensation for other senior executives.】

item.title: 富国银行将回购最多 400 亿美元的普通股
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）周二表示，其董事会已授权一项高达 400 亿美元的股票回购计划。【原文：Wells Fargo said on Tuesday that its board had authorized a stock buyback program of up to $40 billion.】

item.title: 雷诺和 Stellantis 的西班牙工厂在停电后恢复生产
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司在西班牙的两家工厂和 Stellantis 公司在西班牙的三家工厂在周一受到西班牙和葡萄牙大停电的影响后，正逐步恢复生产。【原文：Renault's two factories and Stellantis' three plants in Spain are gradually resuming production after they were impacted by the massive power outage that hit Spain and Portugal on Monday.】

item.title: 亿万富翁投资者约翰-保尔森认为到 2028 年黄金将接近 5,000 美元
item.description: 亿万富翁投资人约翰-保尔森（John Paulson）在接受采访时表示，央行的黄金购买和全球贸易紧张局势可能会推动金银价格在 2028 年达到每盎司 5,000 美元附近，他在采访中重申了对美国矿业项目的承诺。【原文：Central bank gold buying and global trade tensions are likely to push bullion prices to near $5,000 an ounce by 2028, billionaire investor John Paulson said in an interview during which he reinforced his commitment to U.S. mining projects】

item.title: 贷款需求旺盛提振盈利，SoFi Technologies 股价上涨
item.description: 受贷款产品和零售交易业务需求强劲的提振，金融科技公司SoFi Technologies公布的季度业绩好于预期，该公司股价周二上涨。【原文：SoFi Technologies shares gained on Tuesday after the financial technology firm reported better-than-expected quarterly results buoyed by strong demand for its loan products as well as retail trading business.】

item.title: 食品分销商 Sysco 因餐厅客流量疲软下调年度预期
item.description: Sysco 第三季度业绩不及预期，该公司周二下调了全年业绩预期，因为这家食品分销商警告说，在特朗普政府征收关税的背景下，消费者情绪正在恶化。【原文：Sysco's third-quarter results missed estimates and the company lowered its annual forecasts on Tuesday as the food distributor warned of worsening consumer sentiment against the backdrop of the Trump administration's tariffs.】

item.title: 独家报道：特朗普在卡塔尔的首个房地产项目将由卡塔尔 Diar、Dar Global 宣布
item.description: 一位知情人士周二告诉路透社，房地产开发商 Qatari Diar 和 Dar Global 将于周三宣布一项交易，在卡塔尔建造首个特朗普品牌的房地产项目。【原文：Real estate developers Qatari Diar and Dar Global will announce a deal on Wednesday to build Qatar's first Trump-branded real estate project, a source with knowledge of the plans told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份职位空缺下降；裁员人数减少
item.description: 美国 3 月份的职位空缺大幅下降，但裁员人数的减少表明，尽管关税政策的不断变化给经济蒙上了一层阴影，但劳动力市场的基础依然稳固。【原文：U.S. job openings dropped sharply in March, but a decline in layoffs suggested that the labor market remained on solid footing despite an ever-shifting tariffs policy casting a pall over the economy.】

item.title: 洛杉矶港口官员在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，下周航运量将骤降 35
item.description: 洛杉矶港执行董事 Gene Seroka 周二在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，预计下周来自亚洲的货物将减少 35%。【原文：The Los Angeles port is expecting a 35% drop in cargo from Asia next week, Gene Seroka, the port's executive director, said in a CNBC interview on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 4 月消费者信心指数骤降
item.description: 由于对关税的担忧日益加剧，拖累了经济前景，4 月份美国消费者信心下滑至近五年来的最低点。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence slumped to a nearly five-year low in April as growing concerns over tariffs weighed on the economic outlook.】

item.title: 条码扫描仪制造商斑马技术公司预计关税对第二季度利润的影响高达 3,000 万美元
item.description: 斑马技术公司（Zebra Technologies）周二预计第二季度利润低于预期，预计特朗普政府征收关税将给该公司带来 2500 万至 3000 万美元的季度影响。【原文：Zebra Technologies on Tuesday projected lower-than-expected second-quarter profit, anticipating a quarterly impact of $25 million to $30 million from tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 标普全球认为中美贸易战对手的信用评级有喘息空间
item.description: S&P Global 的顶级主权分析师表示，美国和中国的信用评级不太可能因贸易战而迅速受到冲击，受损的更可能是较贫穷的国家和那些已被降级警告的国家。【原文：The United States and China are unlikely to see a rapid hit to their credit ratings from a trade war, S&P Global's top sovereign analyst has said, with damage more likely concentrated on poorer countries and those already on downgrade warnings.】

item.title: 工会、城市和非营利组织起诉阻止特朗普削减劳动力
item.description: 由二十多个工会、城市和非营利组织组成的联盟起诉了唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府，称其广泛削减联邦劳动力是非法夺权。【原文：A coalition of more than two dozen labor unions, cities and nonprofits sued President Donald Trump's administration, claiming that its broad federal workforce cuts were an illegal power grab.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称中国免除美国进口乙烷关税
item.description: 本周二，两位知情人士透露，中国已经免除了本月早些时候对从美国进口乙烷征收的 125% 的关税。【原文：China has waived the 125% tariff on ethane imports from the United States imposed earlier this month, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，马来西亚国家石油公司（Petronas）与英联邦液化天然气公司（Commonwealth LNG）正在洽谈长期供应事宜
item.description: 据四位贸易和行业知情人士透露，马来西亚国有石油天然气公司（Petroliam Nasional，简称 Petronas）正在与 Commonwealth LNG 谈判，从该公司位于路易斯安那州卡梅伦的设施购买液化天然气。【原文：Malaysian state-owned oil and gas firm Petroliam Nasional, or Petronas, is in talks with Commonwealth LNG to buy liquefied natural gas from the U.S. company's facility in Cameron, Louisiana, according to four trading and industry sources with knowledge of the matter.】
